meanings.definition: Introducing or stating something before something else.
meanings.sent1: Prefacing the main topic with a brief explanation can help the audience understand better.
meanings.sent2: She always starts her presentations by prefacing her main points with a short summary.
meanings.sent3: Prefacing the recipe with a joke made the cooking instructions more entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His habit of prefacing bad news with a smile made it easier to accept.
meanings.sent5: Prefacing the warning with a loud alarm made everyone pay attention immediately.

meanings.definition: Serving as an introduction to something else.
meanings.sent1: The prefacing paragraph provided a glimpse into the upcoming story.
meanings.sent2: The prefacing music set the mood for the entire film.
meanings.sent3: Her prefacing remarks were so captivating that everyone eagerly awaited the main event.
meanings.sent4: The prefacing scene in the movie was so powerful that it stayed in the audience's minds long after the film ended.
meanings.sent5: The prefacing image on the book cover perfectly captured the essence of the novel.
